intro: Cynoctonum chiloense, commonly known as the Chilean chilote or chilote tree, is a flowering plant native to Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically important species.
